## 100â€¯Thieves â€“ Dataâ€‘Driven Composition Guide  

> **All percentages are taken from the latest 4â€‘week VCT dataset.**

Sovaâ€¯â†’â€¯Fadeâ€¯â†’â€¯Omen give early vision and vertical control; Neonâ€¯&â€¯Yoru provide fast, unpredictable entries and flankâ€‘pressure. |
| **Secondary** | **Sova (9.6â€¯%)**, **Jett (â‰ˆâ€¯8â€¯%)**, **Omen (9.6â€¯%)**, **Sage (â‰ˆâ€¯7â€¯%)**, **Brimstone (â‰ˆâ€¯6â€¯%)** | **â‰ˆâ€¯5â€¯%** of matches (most common â€œclassicâ€ 2â€‘duelist / 2â€‘controller / 1â€‘sentinel) | **Icebox** â€“ 48.4â€¯% WR (DEFâ€¯48.4â€¯%) | Balancedâ€¯pushâ€¯with strong postâ€‘plant anchoring. Sage gives heal/slowâ€‘push; Brimstoneâ€™s smokes lock down choke points; Jettâ€¯+â€¯Sova create fastâ€‘entry duels. |

\*Pickâ€‘rate is an estimate derived from the individual agent percentages (sum of the five agents Ã·â€¯5).  

---

### 2. Default Setups  

#### 2.1 Defense Formation  

| Site | Anchor / Anchorâ€‘Role | Retake / Support | Midâ€‘Control |
|------|----------------------|------------------|-------------|
| **Aâ€‘Site** | **Sage** (Sentinel) â€“ wall & heal | **Sova** (Initiator) â€“ recon & reconâ€‘dart postâ€‘plant | **Omen** (Controller) â€“ smokes midâ€‘lane inâ€¯â‰ˆâ€¯30â€¯% of rounds |
| **Bâ€‘Site** | **Killjoy** (Sentinel) â€“ turret & alarm | **Fade** (Initiator) â€“ nightmareâ€¯â†’â€¯slowâ€‘push after plant | **Neon** (Duelist) â€“ rotates fast to contest flank |
| **Câ€‘Site** (when present) | **Brimstone** (Controller) â€“ vertical smoke | **Yoru** (Duelist) â€“ teleport flank | **Sova** continues to clear angles |

*Midâ€‘control smokes appear in **30â€¯%** of defensive rounds (matching the 30â€¯% Initiator share).  

#### 2.2 Attack Formation  

- **Standard Spread** â€“ **3â€‘1â€‘1** (3 Duelists, 1 Initiator, 1 Controller/Sentinel)  
  - **Duelists** (Neon, Yoru, Jett) take the first entry.  
  - **Initiator** (Sova/Fade) follows with reconâ€¯â†’â€¯wallâ€‘bangs.  
  - **Controller** (Omen/Brimstone) drops the final smoke/â€‹wall to seal the site.  

- **Entry Order**  
  1. **Neon** (fast dash) or **Yoru** (gate) creates the initial breach.  
  2. **Sova** fires a reconâ€‘dart to clear hidden angles; Fade may follow with a **Prowler** if needed.  
  3. **Omen** slides a **Darkâ€¯Cover** to block sightlines, allowing the remaining duelists to push.  

- **Lurk Tendency**

  - **Yoru** is most often used as the lurker on maps with a central choke (e.g., Icebox, Haven).  

---

### 3. Utility Sequences  

#### 3.1 Aâ€‘Site Execute (Corrode / Bind)  

| Step | Agent | Ability | Timing / Target |
|------|-------|---------|-----------------|
| 1 | **Sova** | Reconâ€¯Dart (longâ€‘range) | Fires from spawn to spot defender positions. |
| 2 | **Omen** | Darkâ€¯Cover (smoke) | Covers the main entry corridor (e.g., â€œAâ€‘Longâ€). |

#### 3.2 Bâ€‘Site Execute (Icebox / Haven)

| 2 | **Brimstone** | Skyâ€‘Smoke (topâ€‘mid) | Blocks sight from â€œBâ€‘Mainâ€. |
| 3 | **Fade** | Nightmare (cone) | Disorients any defender holding â€œBâ€‘Longâ€. |
| 4 | **Jett** | Tailwind (dash) + Cloudburst | Fast entry and quick postâ€‘plant reposition. |
| 5 | **Sage** | Barrierâ€¯Orb (plant cover) | Secures the spike after plant. |

---

### 4. Agent Synergies  

- **Flashâ€¯+â€¯Entry Combo** â€“ *Yoruâ€¯â†’â€¯Jett*: Yoruâ€™s **Gate** places a flash behind the defender, letting Jett **Tailwind** in for a clean kill.  
- **Smokeâ€¯+â€¯Molly Combo** â€“ *Omenâ€¯+â€¯Killjoy*: Omenâ€™s **Darkâ€¯Cover** blocks vision while Killjoyâ€™s **Nanoswarm** forces defenders out of the smoke, creating a safe plant zone.  
- **Info Gathering Loop** â€“ *Sovaâ€¯â†’â€¯Fade*: Sovaâ€™s reconâ€‘dart spots a defender; Fade follows with **Prowler** to confirm and apply a debuff, enabling duelists to trade confidently.  

---

### 5. Role Balance Analysis  

| Role | % of Team | Typical Inâ€‘Game Function |
|------|-----------|--------------------------|
| **Initiator** | **30.0â€¯%** | Early vision, site clearing, postâ€‘plant intel. |
| **Duelist**   | **28.4â€¯%** | Primary entry fraggers, fast map pressure. |

- **Classification** â€“ **Balanced, slightly Initiatorâ€‘heavy**.  
- **Strategic Implication**

  - A modest Sentinel presence (16â€¯%) means **postâ€‘plant anchoring is limited**; teams should compensate with **controllerâ€‘smokes and duelâ€‘fraggers** to hold sites after the spike.  
  - The nearâ€‘equal Duelist/Controller split supports **flexible 3â€‘1â€‘1 spreads**, allowing a quick switch between â€œfullâ€‘pushâ€ (3 Duelists) and â€œslowâ€‘controlâ€ (2 Controllersâ€¯+â€¯1 Initiator) depending on map chokeâ€‘points.  

---

### 6. Quick Action Checklist  

- **Before each map pick:**  
  - âœ… Verify if the map is **Corrode** or **Bind** â†’ run **Primary Comp**.  
  - âœ… If map is **Icebox** or **Haven** â†’ switch to **Secondary Comp** (add Sentinel).  

- **During defense:**  
  - ğŸ“Œ Anchor **Sage/Killjoy** on the site with a **wall/ turret**.  
  - ğŸ“Œ Send **Sova/Fade** to midâ€‘control on the first round; rotate if the enemy pushes.  

- **During attack:**

  - ğŸ“Œ Keep a **lurker (Yoru)** on the opposite side of the map to punish rotations.  

> **Bottom line:** 100â€¯Thievesâ€™ data shows a **highâ€‘tempo, informationâ€‘driven** identity. Use the **Primary Comp** on maps where they already enjoy a >â€¯60â€¯% winâ€‘rate, and fall back to a **more traditional 2â€‘duelist / 2â€‘controller / 1â€‘sentinel** setup when the map demands tighter chokeâ€‘control.

insights.counters:
## Agentâ€‘Specific Counters  

| Opponent Agent | **Counter Agent** | **Utility Counter** | **Positional Denial** |
|----------------|-------------------|---------------------|-----------------------|
| **Sova** |â€¯Jett (orâ€¯Raze) |â€¯Jettâ€™s **Tailwind** into Sovaâ€™s recon bolt line; **Razeâ€¯Blast Pack** to destroy his recon arrows before they ping |â€¯Play **midâ€‘window** (behind the â€œUâ€‘shapedâ€ wall on Ascent) and force Sova to fire from the far corner where his bolt is easily intercepted |
| **Omen** |â€¯Reyna |â€¯Reynaâ€™s **Dismiss** to dodge Omenâ€™s **Shrouded Step** and **Dark Cover**; **Devour** to punish his postâ€‘smoke pushes |â€¯Hold **Bâ€‘site â€œBack Hallâ€** on Ascent; Omenâ€™s teleport is ineffective when you deny the â€œhookâ€ line of sight |
| **Fade** |â€¯Sage |â€¯Sageâ€™s **Barrier Orb** blocks Fadeâ€™s **Prowler** and **Nightfall**; **Resurrection** can nullify a Fadeâ€‘kill chain |â€¯Position on **Aâ€‘site â€œTreeâ€** (Ascent) where Fadeâ€™s **Prowler** cannot clear the high ground without exposing herself |
| **Neon** |â€¯Brimstone |â€¯Brimstoneâ€™s **Sky Smoke** cuts Neonâ€™s **Relay Bolt** line; **Incendiary** denies her **Fast Lane** dash routes |â€¯Guard **mid â€œCâ€‘Boxâ€** on Ascent; Neonâ€™s speed is wasted when forced through smoke and tight choke |
| **Yoru** |â€¯Cypher |â€¯Cypherâ€™s **Trapwire** and **Spycam** expose Yoruâ€™s **Dimensional Rift**; **Neonâ€¯Pulse** (if you run Neon) can force him out of the rift |â€¯Play **Aâ€‘site â€œTriple Boxâ€**; Yoruâ€™s teleport is blocked by Cypherâ€™s **Cyber Cage** and the tight angles |

---

### **Sova Counter Protocol**
- **Earlyâ€‘game**: Deploy **Jettâ€™s Tailwind** or **Razeâ€¯Blast Pack** into the expected reconâ€‘bolt trajectory (midâ€‘window on Ascent).  
- **Midâ€‘round**: If Sova fires a **Recon Bolt**, **Jett** can **Blade Storm** the arrow before it lands, denying intel.  
- **Lateâ€‘round**: Force Sova to **use his ultimate** (Hunterâ€™sâ€¯Fury) from a corner; **Jett** can **airâ€‘dash** out of the line of fire and pick him off.  

### **Omen Counter Protocol**
- **Eco/Force Rounds**: **Reyna** should **Dismiss** any incoming **Shrouded Step** and **push** through the smoke with **Leer** to blind defenders.  
- **Standard Rounds**: Use **Reynaâ€™s Devour** after a successful entry to sustain while Omenâ€™s **Dark Cover** is active.  
- **Lateâ€‘round**: Force Omen to **teleport** into a preâ€‘placed **Sage Barrier** on Bâ€‘site; he loses his smokes and the round.  

### **Fade Counter Protocol**
- **Initial Contact**: **Sage** places **Barrier Orb** at the entrance of the site (Aâ€‘tree on Ascent) to block **Prowler**.  
- **Utility Trade**: When Fade uses **Nightfall**, **Sage** drops a **Slow Orb** to reduce its radius, then **Resurrect** any teammate killed.  
- **Rotations**: Keep a **Sage** **Healing Orb** on the far side of mid to deny Fadeâ€™s **Seize** chase.  

### **Neon Counter Protocol**
- **Speed Denial**: **Brimstone** drops **Sky Smoke** at Neonâ€™s **Fast Lane** entry points (Bâ€‘site â€œBack Hallâ€).  
- **Utility Trade**: Follow with **Incendiary** to force Neon to **reset** her dash, wasting her **Relay Bolt** charge.  
- **Lateâ€‘round**: Use **Brimstoneâ€™s Stim Beacon** to boost your own speed, matching Neonâ€™s burst and allowing a clean retake.  

### **Yoru Counter Protocol**
- **Rift Exposure**: **Cypher** plants **Trapwire** across the **Dimensional Rift** exit lane (midâ€‘window).  
- **Vision Denial**: Activate **Cyber Cage** on the riftâ€™s entry to block Yoruâ€™s **Fakeout**.  
- **Postâ€‘Rift Play**: If Yoru appears, **Cypher** uses **Neonâ€¯Pulse** (if you have Neon) or **Sageâ€™s Barrier** to trap him, then **execute** with a duelâ€‘ready duelist.  

---

## Map Control Denial (Ascent)

- **Aâ€‘Site**:  
  - Stack **midâ€‘window** utility (smokes/â€‹walls) on the first round; rotate **late** (after 15â€¯s) to catch 100â€¯Thieves expecting a default.  
  - Use **Sage Barrier** on the â€œTreeâ€ to block Sovaâ€™s recon and Fadeâ€™s Prowler.  

- **Bâ€‘Site**:

- **Timing Windows**:  
  - **15â€‘25â€¯s**: Deploy early smokes/â€‹walls to force a **rush** into a contested choke.  
  - **30â€‘40â€¯s**: Drop a second layer of utility (e.g., **Jett Blade Storm** or **Raze Blast Pack**) to deny lateâ€‘round **slowâ€‘push** from Fade or Yoru.  

---

## Economic Warfare

- **Antiâ€‘Eco Protocol** (48.7â€¯% eco win rate)  
  - **Forceâ€‘Buy**: On rounds where 100â€¯Thieves have **<â€¯4â€¯k** credits, **buy a full buy** (including a **Sage** or **Brimstone** for utility) and **press** the site immediately.  
  - **Utility Spam**: Use cheap **smokes** (Brimstone) and **traps** (Cypher) to **force trades**; they lose the few credits they have.  

- **Bonus Round Denial**  
  - **Roundâ€¯1**: Play a **fastâ€‘push** (underâ€¯40â€¯s) with **Jett** and **Raze** to capitalize on their likely **rush**.  
  - **Roundâ€¯3â€‘5**: Switch to a **default** (mid control) to drain their economy; deny **Sova** recon by keeping mid **unâ€‘smoked**.  

---

## Setup Breakers

- **Default Defense Break**  
  - **Mid Control**: Send a **Sage** and **Cypher** duo to **hold mid** with **Barrier** and **Trapwire**; force 100â€¯Thieves to **rotate** early, breaking their siteâ€‘stack.  
  - **Utility Counter**: Follow with **Jett Tailwind** into the enemyâ€™s **smoke line** to clear vision and expose their positions.  

- **Utility to Counter Site Holds**

  - **Bâ€‘Site**: **Cypher**â€¯â†’â€¯**Cyber Cage** on â€œBack Hallâ€ + **Trapwire** across â€œBâ€‘doorâ€ to stop **Neon** dash and **Yoru** rift.  

- **Lateâ€‘Round Execution**

  - **Tradeâ€‘Ready**: Keep a **Reyna** on standby to **Dismiss** any unexpected Omen smoke and **Devour** for sustain.  

> **Bottom Line:**â€¯Neutralize 100â€¯Thievesâ€™ core agents with the listed counters, dominate midâ€‘window control on Ascent, and exploit their subâ€‘50â€¯% eco win rate by forceâ€‘buying and utilityâ€‘spam on lowâ€‘credit rounds. This multiâ€‘layered approach forces them into unfavorable rotations and erodes their economy, paving the way for consistent site captures.
